member.name: T:Newtonsoft.Json.Bson.BsonDataReader
member.summary: Represents a reader that provides fast, non-cached, forward-only access to serialized BSON data.

member.name: M:Newtonsoft.Json.Bson.BsonDataReader.ReadAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Asynchronously reads the next JSON token from the source.
member.param: The token to monitor for cancellation requests. The default value is .
member.returns: A that represents the asynchronous read. The property returns true if the next token was read successfully; false if there are no more tokens to read.
member.remarks: Derived classes must override this method to get asynchronous behaviour. Otherwise it will execute synchronously, returning an already-completed task. Asynchronous behaviour is also not available when the constructor was passed an instance of type derived from .

member.name: M:Newtonsoft.Json.Bson.BsonDataReader.ReadAsBooleanAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Asynchronously reads the next JSON token from the source as a of .
member.param: The token to monitor for cancellation requests. The default value is .
member.returns: A that represents the asynchronous read. The property returns the of . This result will be null at the end of an array.
member.remarks: Derived classes must override this method to get asynchronous behaviour. Otherwise it will execute synchronously, returning an already-completed task. Asynchronous behaviour is also not available when the constructor was passed an instance of type derived from .

member.remarks: Derived classes must override this method to get asynchronous behaviour. Otherwise it will execute synchronously, returning an already-completed task. Asynchronous behaviour is also not available when the constructor was passed an instance of type derived from .

member.name: P:Newtonsoft.Json.Bson.BsonDataReader.JsonNet35BinaryCompatibility
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether binary data reading should be compatible with incorrect Json.NET 3.5 written binary.

member.name: M:Newtonsoft.Json.Bson.BsonDataReader.Read
member.summary: Reads the next JSON token from the underlying .
member.returns: true if the next token was read successfully; false if there are no more tokens to read.

member.name: M:Newtonsoft.Json.Bson.BsonDataReader.Close
member.summary: Changes the reader's state to . If is set to true, the underlying is also closed.

member.name: T:Newtonsoft.Json.Bson.BsonDataWriter
member.summary: Represents a writer that provides a fast, non-cached, forward-only way of generating BSON data.

member.name: M:Newtonsoft.Json.Bson.BsonDataWriter.FlushAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Asynchronously flushes whatever is in the buffer to the destination and also flushes the destination.
member.param: The token to monitor for cancellation requests. The default value is .
member.returns: A that represents the asynchronous operation.
member.remarks: Because BSON documents are written as a single unit, only , and the final , or that finishes writing the document will write asynchronously. Derived classes will not write asynchronously.

member.name: M:Newtonsoft.Json.Bson.BsonDataWriter.WriteEndAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Asynchronously writes the end of the current JSON object or array.
member.param: The token to monitor for cancellation requests. The default value is .
member.returns: A that represents the asynchronous operation.
member.remarks: Because BSON documents are written as a single unit, only , and the final , or that finishes writing the document will write asynchronously. Derived classes will not write asynchronously.

member.name: M:Newtonsoft.Json.Bson.BsonDataWriter.WriteEndArrayAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Asynchronously writes the end of an array.
member.param: The token to monitor for cancellation requests. The default value is .
member.returns: A that represents the asynchronous operation.
member.remarks: Because BSON documents are written as a single unit, only , and the final , or that finishes writing the document will write asynchronously. Derived classes will not write asynchronously.

member.name: M:Newtonsoft.Json.Bson.BsonDataWriter.WriteEndObjectAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Asynchronously writes the end of a JSON object.
member.param: The token to monitor for cancellation requests. The default value is .
member.returns: A that represents the asynchronous operation.
member.remarks: Because BSON documents are written as a single unit, only , and the final , or that finishes writing the document will write asynchronously. Derived classes will not write asynchronously.

member.name: M:Newtonsoft.Json.Bson.BsonDataWriter.CloseAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Asynchronously closes this writer. If is set to true, the destination is also closed.
member.param: The token to monitor for cancellation requests. The default value is .
member.returns: A that represents the asynchronous operation.
member.remarks: Because BSON documents are written as a single unit, only , and the final , or that finishes writing the document will write asynchronously. Derived classes will not write asynchronously.

member.name: P:Newtonsoft.Json.Bson.BsonDataWriter.DateTimeKindHandling
member.summary: Gets or sets the used when writing values to BSON. When set to no conversion will occur.
member.value: The used when writing values to BSON.

member.summary: Flushes whatever is in the buffer to the underlying and also flushes the underlying stream.

member.summary: Writes the end.

member.name: M:Newtonsoft.Json.Bson.BsonDataWriter.Close
member.summary: Closes this writer. If is set to true, the underlying is also closed. If is set to true, the JSON is auto-completed.
